page.title: 03One day in Sigglesthorne
page.content: Tuesday 16th July 1985 It is a day of low cloud and rain today so that means that the high speed Tornado and Lightening{jets}will not be passing over, at low levels, on their way to the practice bombing range, 4 miles away at Cowden. There will be other slow speed visitors; the{postlady}will come from Seaton, the{library van}calls fortnightly, the mobile{bread shop and the mobile{butcher}may call. Severe{storms}over the weekend flattened the crops in many fields but the farmers will still be able to combine them but not as efficiently. Tomorrow many of the local people will have a day off to go to{Driffield {Show}to meet other farmers and participate in the competitions. {School}is open: people travel to {work:}the{village}is{quiet.
